WRITING.TEXT: Wowowowow! You look fab!
Fellow essense bride here! It looks amaaazing on you! How long did they say it would take? Ive got 5 months until i see mine again :(
I have a sapphire too! 3 Lovely ring!

This just inspired FH and us to order monkey cake toppers. We LOVE monkeys. We ordered [these guys](https://www.etsy.com/listing/270431283/custom-monkey-wedding-cake-topper?ref=listing-shop-header-1) (with that same purple as our main color!).
Apparently not here. December to march is but i was told november is still "on" at least before thanksgiving

I dont think so. Im in nyc and i thought being in a big city wed be SOL because theres just so many people getting married here all the time. We got engaged in february and found multiple venues with November availability... of this year! But it was literally the first thing we did.

Best: literally trying on the dresses. I had so much fun just walking out and seeing myself in all these different dresses! And it helps the place i bought mine was run by this lovely lady who didnt put any pressure on me to buy. Worst: I honestly was in the boat of liking multiple dresses, like, a lot. There wasn't a "one" there was like...three that i loved. And so i had to just make a decision, even though any of the three would've been great. I was hoping there would be one that was a cut above the rest, but that never really happened for me, so it made decision making harder!

October. September is going to be crazy hot, and its still going to be PACKED. October is my favorite time of year to go (and ive been there 12 times, #13 upcoming in 2 weeks. yeah im one of those people). And there will always be kids. I mean, my parents took me out of school to go twice, because they didnt want to go in the sweltering heat of summer. Key here is get to parks when they open. seriously, you'll get so much done, and by afternoon you'll be able to take it slower.
UGH me too. I have to wait 5 months for mine and i just want to put it back on every day!
Im in NYC, but my DOC is 2400. I never actually priced out full planners because im a planner extraordinaire haha and i didnt love offsetting that to someone else.

i went to a wedding that had 12 people in EACH SIDE. it was... a bit much haha. However, i think seven is totally fine. Its when you creep into double digits that i think people might think its too much.

I think the problem is its sometimes hard to get hair combs to stay IN short hair, and to hold up a veil haha. I think i may do a halo... i think that could work! Yeah, maybe my hair "fancy" is equivalent to blow drying it out so it has more texture. thats about it!
i think it all depends on exactly WHAT went wrong, whether you can actually ask for money back. Can you give us some detail?
something in the middle. i uploaded a [fresh cut photo](https://imgur.com/a/LqzmV) (and fresh color!) to show you what it looks like. It's def not a pixie cut, but yea more like a bob.

WRITING.TITLE: What Are My Short Haired (like, above the chin) Ladies Doing for Hair Pieces?
WRITING.TEXT: Every time i look up short wedding hair styles, they give me hair between chin and shoulders. Mine is much shorter. at it's "longest" when i need a cut, its almost chin length. A fresh cut puts it much shorter, like mid cheek length. there's not much i can "do" with it at that length, like stylistically, but im trying to decide what to do for hair pieces. Was leaning towards a halo or headband. Is that what other short haired gals are doing? does anyone have any pics i can reference? thanks!
they are both lovely, but the second is more eye catching with the detail! the first could let you go crazy with some really awesome jewelry, though.
yes, in store! There's a huge one here on 34th st in Manhattan, their flagship, so thats where i found it. I would definitely check out a local DSW you never know!

Zola Honeyfund. That's it. We live together and have for 3 years, so our Zola isn't even full of enough gifts for everyone because we already have so much! So we almost would rather people just give to the honeyfund!
yup, heel height was so important to me. I love these too!! Anything under 3 inches i think is perfect if you are going to wear it all night!

Yes. We are not traditional in that we feel we have to wait until walking down the aisle, or that it's "Bad luck" or anything like that. It makes sense logistically to have a first look in Central Park, 2 blocks away from the venue, and then do all the photos before the ceremony so there will be no mid event photos to take us away from the fun! Also, i think if we see each other ahead of time, it'll mean less nerves during the ceremony. And i'd love to have that time together before hand.
I walked quite a bit in the store and didn't experience digging. The material definitely had some give. Im going to wear them around the house a bit ro break them in!

they are SO perfect! They were the perfect color, and heel height. plus i loved the stacked heel. I almost got a kitten heel but i felt like i was going to topple over in it; i feel less steady in a stiletto kitten heel than a 4 inch one, not sure why. And then i found these...and they were so cheap too!
ooo i was eyeing that back drop necklace! it looks so lovely.
Betsey johnson maibel in champagne glitter. Only 60 at dsw! Plus with my $10 reward, make that a solid $50. Bam! So comfy too!
i cant see your links likely because they are linking to a private transaction, but im glad to hear a great review!!!
its a LOVELY dress! congrats!
That really was what was tempting about it all. Cassia was only $1150. Dress i ended up buying was $1695. But, i felt like i could justify a $500 difference. If it was more than that, likely not!
Here's hoping you get Maria if you go to the same location, she was lovely!
I did not end up going to Lovely Bride, but id love to hear what you think! I bought my dress at Angelique Bridal,. highly recommend if you don't find something on Saturday!
which dress did you get?

WRITING.TITLE: My BHLDN Experience (Rave!)
WRITING.TEXT:
I know there's a lot of mixed feels here about BHLDN and even the two locations here in NYC have very mixed reviews online. But i gave it a shot last weekend and went to the one in the UES. Here's my [album of some of my favorite dresses i tried on](http://imgur.com/a/NWaev). I almost bought the Cassia, but if you guys saw my [earlier post](https://www.reddit.com/r/weddingplanning/comments/62wj9w/said_yes_to_the_dress_today_if_your_initials_are/), I went with a totally different Essense of Australia dress at a different place!
Anyway, first my stylist was Maria, and she was a pleasure. No pushyness, no rushing, as some people seemed to have experienced at the location. No champagne in a can either though, maybe because it was only noon? ha. She had all the dresses i asked for online when i made the appt and let me pick a few extras. Had 3 people with me which was totally fine. You do have to show off your dress in basically a pretty public viewing area, where i was surrounded by women trying on bridesmaid dresses and another bride to be, so if having total stranger comment on your dress isnt your thing, dont do it! (they were all VERY nice to me, btw, no mean comments ha).
The samples are a bit...raggedy. Especially if you look at the back of the Cassia, its pretty stepped on and dirty. That was disappointing. Also she put a belt immediately on with the dress, which i guess was kind of an upsell if i had gotten it, but to be frank, it looked 10x better with the belt.
I told her I had another appt after, there was no pressure, just a business card with the dress and belt names and price and her name. Their stuff is GORGEOUS but ultimately i picked something that i think suited my evening NYC wedding better. But if you want that boho princess/fairytale look for a good price, id go for it. The Freesia is only $900, for example!
Anyway, i just wanted to share my positive experience overall. If anyone has any questions let me know!

Because we used Zola, we added some experiences, like tickets for a broadway show, cooking classes, a couples massage. We also added a small $200 fund that anyone can contribute any amount to, to help us grow our vinyl collection! things like that. Sometimes checking out other people's registries on zola, like the ones they feature, helps in giving ideas.
B. They are both gorgeous, btw but B made me go "oh wow."

Honestly, if your friend can't see why you would want to uninvite him after she was there to SEE what happened, then thats something you need to work out outside of the wedding. But if any guy friend, boyfriend of a friend, fiance of a friend etc slapped me on the ass, they were be off my wedding guestlist and on my shitlist. Real talk.

Yeah, people are taking things waaaay personal. I feel like maybe that needs some introspection as to why they are letting one reddit post bother them so much? *shrug* I too, thought it was hilarious, and I LOVE the idea of offbeat weddings.
yeah, we considered it and thought about how many times ive ever looked at a stamp on mail i receive. Pretty sure zero times. So i decided to go with regular ol' stamps!

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone have experience with this jewelry seller on etsy?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi ladies, looking at some simple jewelry to go with my dress, as my dress has a ton of detail. I've been eyeing some stuff by [this seller](https://www.etsy.com/shop/GlamorousBijoux) (Especially the backdrop necklaces) and was wondering if anyone here has ordered from them specifically. Or, if you have any recommendations for similar sellers id love to hear them!

So our officiant does the rehearsal, just an hour before the ceremony, and I am not even needed there! (woo!). It's literally like, the wedding party, groom, and anyone else walking down the aisle...the end. She just gives them a quick run through of how they walk down, who needs to do what at what points of the ceremony, and thats it. no big to do, no meeting the day before, etc.

AS a big Disney World goer (I have an annual pass, yadda yadda), I can tell you it will NOT be a relaxing trip. Yes, there are relaxing things to do there, but if you havent been before, or havent been in years, you'll probably push all that to the wayside to get to see and do everything else. I agree you need a city/state where you've got stuff to do and see but also beaches or spas and other relaxing areas. San Fran as mentioned is great, Santa Monica too.
FH and I are generally adventurous travelers, but he surprised me by saying he too wanted some chill on a beach and do nothing time. So we're doing Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, and half of that time will be spent at beachside resorts and the other half doing temple tours/city stuff. I'm looking forward to the mix!

No obligation. I had a caterer who followed up asking what he "did wrong" which was a weird way of asking for feedback. And then...he called me. out of the blue. i didn't pick up, but it seemed really forward. Then emailed me AGAIN asking what he could do differently. it felt like a weird break up! normally id give some feedback because i see how it can be helpful, but the 2 emails and phone call freaked me out, so i ignored him.

Thanks! We're going with a bit of an art deco vibe for the STD and invites since the building we're getting married in was built in 1919. I am just waiting on return address stickers to come in and then I can send these out!

WRITING.TITLE: Save the Dates are here! Can't wait to send them out!

WRITING.TEXT: I cannot get over how stunning your dress is. I love everything about it!

I totally feel you. I have moderate to severe IBS, so living with a chronic illness is a b*tch and i am often grateful for a man that wants to marry me despite my constant need for doctors, or having to miss events due to my stomach.

We almost did that area ourselves! in fact we thought for sure we would, but then we found our venue in manhattan and fell in love. I've been to several weddings in that area and LOVED every one! whats your venue?
The detail is stunning! and your train reminds me of mine so of course i love it :D

i never worry about death but since being engaged, i keep worrying that IM going to die! 3 weeks ago i felt a lump in my throat in a really specific place and FREAKED. Went to dr, had blood and thyroid checked, everything came back fine, yadda yadda. But i was so worried i couldnt stop focusing on the feeling and thus, it wouldn't go away. And then i learned you can totally have feelings of things in your throat from stress. Derp. But yeah im having the same reaction but for me instead; what if i dont live to see my wedding? or my honeymoon? or anything else that comes after? ugh. its so stupid!
when i go to the gym, right back in the box he proposed with! When im in the shower or cleaning, just on a desk somewhere.
In the shower, when im cleaning dishes, and when im lifting weights, i take it off. Otherwise, its on!

Just picked out the dress yesterday! Meeting the (potential) DJ the caterer this week. And our save the date came in early! though I'm still waiting on the stamps and return address labels to come in, but i can probably send them out within a week or so. So many big things being checked off, so im feeling good!
Just got mine ordered today! Was told 5 months, but she'd follow up with the exact date as soon as she knows. so who really knows!
It's actually not a belt, but part of the design! Which is what i really loved about it.
I just went with the same one today, dress twins! Is yours the ivory/champagne? I have NO idea what shoes to buy for this dress! Any thoughts?
So many yeses today (me included!). The train on this is loooovely. and that back!

yeah I just started really going through the comments... wow people are RUDE. I am totally OK with someone not giving a gift if they spent $$ on travel or what have you, but like... jeez. Some of the things these people said, its like, do your friends who invited you know you feel this way? because maybe then they wouldn't have bothered inviting you to begin with.
My wedding is in Manhattan. I have family in New Jersey, a 90 min drive away. My FH has family in CT, an hour or so away. None of them consider this a "destination" wedding. That's...ridiculous.
thank you! i felt truly "bridal" in it so i knew it was the one!
Yay date twins! thank you!
If Belle's dress was white and weddingy, this is what it'd look like!
I saw these at Macys today! loved them but were personally too high for me. Great choice!

Here's the [imgur link](http://imgur.com/a/LKSCv) that also shows off the back. I tried this on 3 weeks ago, and then today I went to BHLDN and tried on the Cassia dress and thought it was it. And trust me guys, that dress is beautiful! but it felt more outdoor/daytime wedding and this felt more like the evening, classic NYC wedding im having. I went back today to try it on after BHLDN and yeah... it was still it. I don't think either dress would've been the wrong decision, and it was definitely tough, but this one ultimately won out! It's Essense of Australia.

WRITING.TITLE: Said Yes to the Dress Today! If Your Initials are PM don't you DARE look!

WRITING.TEXT: Originally the trip was just going to be Thailand Cambodia, but FH has wanted to go to Vietnam foreeever, and since we're right there it made sense! I think Ho Chi Minh city with any day trips we can do; he's super into war history so he wants to see the museums. I imagine we'll be doing 4 days there.

Iceland is wonderful, i went there 2 years ago and it was such a great time! Definitely take time to get on some of those long drives outside of the city, though. the landscape is beautiful. and definitely do blue lagoon! You can also horseback ride across volcanic rock. it's lovely there!
that layered skirt is gorgeous!
dont be that jealous, we're doing it all in 2 to 2 1/2 weeks, so we'll have much less time in vietnam than you, thats for sure!

Would love to hear your planning for Vietnam! We're doing Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, so would love to know what you're doing!
I've barely thought about gift for him yet haha im still trying to figure out bridal party gifts! but i do think i'll be doing one, i just haven't figured out what!

I am going to do both as well! I know all my friends in their late 20s, early 30s will probably do it online. All my family will probably do it by paper. Whatever is easiest and gets those RSVPs actually in!
oh wow those are great!

A great photographer will help you feel more relaxed, but in general, its going to be weird at first. It totally was for me! We just did ours last weekend. First 30 minutes I felt really awkward giving him kisses on the cheek etc. Then i started to just go with the flow, and sometimes in between shots id relax and start just laughing with him, and didnt really realize the the photographer was still taking pics haha. We also had to pretend we werent freezing in windy and rainy weather, but we did it! you'll be OK! i promise. expect awkwardness at first, but i promise it'll get better.
its got plot holes, but ive always loved this movie. super entertaining.
I am trying on dresses in store on Saturday, so im excited! im hoping something i love is on sale ;)
haha i appreciate it, but its totally fine! I can definitely just pick a few of these babies up ;)
oh those are GREAT! i love the design on them, very much what im looking for!
No idea for my old or borrowed! I need to call my grandma and see if she has something for the "old" part. New would be the dress, and blue is my sapphire engagement ring :)
They are cuter in person then they are online! wow!

WRITING.TITLE: Frames for Wedding Signs?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi all, I am looking to do a couple of print outs from etsy, one for the bar, one for a memorial table, and maybe one other. Where did you get frames for your wedding signs? I saw some awesome vintage ones on etsy but of course, pricier than i would hope. Our wedding will be held at [The Harold Pratt House](http://www.pratthouse.com/) which has a 1920s vibe, and so our sign print outs will be Gatsby like...so preferably vintage or gold frames would work. Im not opposed to doing a little DIY spray painting though!

YES. I am also in NYC and having this problem. Someone cancelled a recent purchase that I already sent out... which granted i was a few days late on but INFORMED them and they were fine with it. well, usps never scanned so they just cancelled citing delayed shipping...and now i have a jacket out in the ether going to them. I emailed poshmark and got that automated "we have a lot of emails" message. bleh.
Not that big, as I currently sell what ive owned. So, 62 listings.
They literally cannot do anything about a negative review. especially if your experience actually happened. Ignore them, don't take it down, and don't worry about it.
My best friend went through the same thing. Her now wife has very homophobic cousins. They were not invited and they did not regret the decision at all!

they are currently doing an anniversary sale, code is NINE and it gets you 15% off. I just used it on save the dates! From what ive seen I haven't seen discounts much higher than that, but i haven't been tracking it THAT long so maybe someone else has more insight :)

$200 Nespresso machine $300 Le Creuset Dutch Oven (holy crap and thats on SALE!) $200 bar cart
We don't NEED any of these things...but hey... they are there if anyone wants to buy it for us ;)
I did mine not as a "hey we're engaged!" but as something to have for our save the dates and website, as well as for us!

Is it bad i want to fuck with them by emailing them and saying "i am really impressed by your ability to time travel, though it seems you are stuck with going to only one date. Still, id love to know what oct 18th, 2023 looks like in my future!"

It's really all going to vary by region, but I can tell you what my photographer is here in NYC. MY photographer is a little on the higher price but he's wonderful! We are paying 4,600 for 10 hours of photography, 2 photographers, 700 photos minimum, + album. His prices definitely go higher, but a lot of that are packages with extra albums etc.

WRITING.TITLE: Wedding Win - Save The Dates Ordered!
WRITING.TEXT: Just ordered the save the dates after getting our edited engagement photos. Plus ordered stamps and return address labels. Phew! Getting there! What are your wedding wins this week so far?
its BEAUTIFUL! congrats!

We're doing both. The table numbers that match our invitations allow both a number AND a name underneath, so that we could name them as we wanted (cities we've visited or are important to us) but keep it not too confusing for everyone.
FINALLY JOHNNY! GOD! haha im sure you are relieved, I know I am after following this saga!
We're inviting 145 people but im secretly hoping like a good 20 say no haha

I want to first preface by saying im very lucky that my FH's family is well off, and wants to pay for our wedding (and they arent crazy and want to make all the decisions either, they are literally letting us do what we want!). So, catering is a splurge. Though i mean, catering in manhattan is expensive no matter what. But we're going with a caterer that is going to cost us about 33k. (keep in mind though generally they are about 25k).
We're also going to splurge 2 nights at a suite at the Gramercy Park Hotel for the night before and night of the wedding, since we aren't doing our honeymoon until 2 months later :)

I hate the phone too (ive had what i call "phone anxiety" since i was like, 10 years old!) but honestly...its the best way you are going to get a hold of these people. Remember, it's for your wedding! its important! deep breath and just dial that number!

music pre-ceremony whil all are filing in will be piano and violin renditions of lesser known disney songs, as I am a big disney (And disney world specifically) fan. We are not doing programs but handing out "acheivements" for people to accomplish since both FH and I are gamers. Everything else about our wedding is pretty tradtional otherwise!

I did not have any prepared undergarments, as I have no idea what im going to wear under until i know my dress! However, i wore a strapless bra which my attendant prefer i take off because it just took away from the back of a lot of them, plus a few styles had built in cups. I dont think it'll be awkward to do solo at all, im sure thousands of brides go solo all the time, and they are experienced in this! Besides, id say a huge chunk of my time was spent talking to and getting to know my attendant during dress changes, and my FMIL was involved only when i stepped out to look in the mirror, but iwouldve been fine solo!
Our DJ will cost a little over 2K and thats with ceremony cocktail hour included. No extra charge for multiple songs, thats silly!
I am very, very blessed to have amazing in laws as well. Love it, appreciate it, because it doesnt always happen!
it is beautiful! and perfect, i think, for someone who otherwise never wears makeup. it isnt a crazy drastic change.
2 weeks ago before my first dress shopping appointment i dreamed the people who were supposed to come with me all slowly texted or called me and bailed, and i had to go dress shopping by myself.
The back of #2 made my jaw drop, so im gonna go with that one!
oh nice! I am in NYC and right now there's no date but if its early summer that can still work out well for us!
10/14 feels like a very popular day this year, i was already invited to two weddings on that same day! Best of luck to all of you!
alright, ill give it a try!

We almost did Central Park, but i agree that i felt it wasnt very creative. We realized we just love the Highline (we walk it when we get the chance pretty often!) and so it made sense to do it there! It was a little tough with the crowds, as it is ALWAYS crowded, but it worked out for us. We also considered down the cobblestone side streets of the West Village.

This is actually not our wedding photographer, but a friend of mine who is a photographer who offered as an engagement present :) He does work professionally though, so if you are interested let me know and I can connect you!
yeah im giving myself a 2-3 drink a week cap. and if i hit that (like, we went out on Saturday night and i had 2 drinks at dinner) i have to wait 7 days until i can have it again.

How my dad is doing it; he ordered a new credit card thats going to get him ALL the miles to come to our wedding (he retired and moved to Colombia! so he has a ways to go) and he's giving it to us to use it that he will pay off, and then get the miles for! pretty smart. Anything left over, he will be depositing straight to my savings.

so my dad is giving us $20k as well, and we said it was too much!!! Especially with my FH's parents paying for a big chunk of the wedding already. He saw it as "fine, use 10k, keep 10k as a wedding gift." Sure, we could go a little more crazy with vendors/wedding budget, but we're pretty happy with what we've got, and so keeping that $$ as a couple sounds more like what we want to do with it anyway. So, talk to them about the amount. Ask them if you can accept it as more of a gift, for a future car, house down payment, etc. It'll go a lot farther!

grams. I think my problem is i also use an app (lifesum) and sometimes, i wonder how accurate they are in the end. Any tips on how to make sure im counting grams appropriately? Its totally possible my carbs are higher than i think!
I guess thats the trade off, huh! there's a bazillion vendors here! but they are all SO expensive!
It kills me how cheap weddings are NOT in NYC haha our day of coordinator alone is about... 10x what you paid for yours! It sounds like despite a few small bumps you had a LOVELY wedding! congrats!
oh i have aaaall the experience with that, especially when i was a teenager. bit right through that stuff. Literally, im a robot. A nail biting machine lmao
